catch_line: REMOVAL OR DESTRUCTION OF WARNING DEVICES.

1.name: ARTICLE L. - SIGNING AND TRAFFIC ROUTING IN THE EVENT OF STREET OBSTRUCTION
1.label: article

full_text:
No person shall take, steal, move, remove, carry away, destroy, damage or otherwise impair or impede the effectiveness for its intended use, any lamp, lantern, torch, blinking light, reflecting sign, reflecting barricade, traffic cone, barricade, or any other sign, signal, or warning device which has been placed or erected at any place in the City for the purpose of warning and safeguarding the public in the event of the construction, maintenance, repair, opening or closing of any street as defined in this article. 
(Code 1959 , §19-42)

dublin_core.Title: REMOVAL OR DESTRUCTION OF WARNING DEVICES.

plain_text:
CODE OF STATE

REMOVAL OR DESTRUCTION OF WARNING DEVICES. (§ 11-2242)

No person shall take, steal, move, remove, carry away, destroy, damage or
otherwise impair or impede the effectiveness for its intended use, any lamp,
lantern, torch, blinking light, reflecting sign, reflecting barricade, traffic
cone, barricade, or any other sign, signal, or warning device which has been
placed or erected at any place in the City for the purpose of warning and
safeguarding the public in the event of the construction, maintenance, repair,
opening or closing of any street as defined in this article. 
(Code 1959 , §19-42)
